paths.name: Linux Fundamentals
paths.description: Start your Linux journey with basic concepts and commands

modules.name: Filesystem Navigation
objectives: Navigate directories using cd, ls, pwd
Work with absolute and relative paths

quiz.question: What is the root directory in Linux?
quiz.explanation: The / (forward slash) represents the root directory, the top of the filesystem hierarchy.

quiz.question: Which command shows your current directory?
quiz.explanation: pwd (print working directory) shows your current location in the filesystem.

modules.name: Essential Commands
objectives: Master basic file operations (ls, cp, mv, rm)
Use text processing tools (cat, grep, sed)

quiz.question: Which command copies files?
quiz.explanation: cp (copy) duplicates files or directories from source to destination.

paths.name: System Administration
paths.description: Learn to manage and maintain Linux systems

modules.name: Process Control
objectives: Monitor system processes with ps, top, htop
Control process priorities with nice and renice

quiz.question: What is PID 1 in Linux?
quiz.explanation: PID 1 is the init process (systemd on modern systems), the first userspace process.

paths.name: Kernel & Performance
paths.description: Deep dive into kernel internals and system optimization

paths.name: Computer Science Concepts
paths.description: Learn CS theory through Linux implementation

modules.name: Algorithms in Linux
objectives: Understand O(log n) scheduling in CFS

challenges.name: Permission Denied
challenges.scenario: You need to run a script but get 'Permission denied'. Fix it!
challenges.hint: Check file permissions with ls -l and make it executable

challenges.name: Disk Space Detective
challenges.scenario: The disk is full! Find files larger than 100MB in /var

challenges.name: Zombie Process Hunter
challenges.scenario: Find and identify zombie processes on the system
challenges.hint: Check process state in ps output

challenges.name: Network Connectivity
challenges.scenario: Website won't load. Diagnose the network issue
challenges.hint: Check DNS, routing, and connectivity step by step
challenges.solution: ping google.com; nslookup google.com; ip route show

glossary.definition: The core of the operating system that manages hardware resources and provides services to programs.
An instance of a running program with its own memory space and resources.
A background process that runs continuously, providing services to other processes.
Process ID - a unique numerical identifier for each running process.
Index node - a data structure that stores metadata about a file or directory.
An endpoint for network communication between processes.
